Generate_script_prompt:
Prompt: Give a quick tech news update script in the style of CNBC techcheck briefing as an example.
        Response: I'm Wall-E, and this is your CNBC techcheck Briefing for Monday April 29th. Tesla is asking shareholders to reinstate CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which a Delaware judge voided earlier this year. The judge ruled that the record-setting compensation deal was, quote, deeply flawed. Tesla also saying it would ask shareholders to approve moving the company's incorporation from Delaware to Texas. The company has hired a proxy solicitor and plans to spend millions of dollars to help secure votes for the two proposals. Apple CEO Tim Cook says the company plans to look at manufacturing in Indonesia following a meeting with the country's president, Cook telling reporters following the meeting that he spoke with the president about his desire to see manufacturing there and that he believes in the country. The comments come as Apple is pushed to diversify its supply chain with more manufacturing outside of China in countries such as Vietnam and India. Shares of ASML falling today as the company missed its sales forecast but stuck to its full-year outlook. Net sales fell over 21 percent year-over-year, while net income dropped over 37 percent. ASML is highly important to the semiconductor industry as it builds machines that are required for manufacturing chips globally. Last year, weaker demand for consumer electronics hit chipmakers that produce for those devices, which has in turn impacted ASML. That's all for today. We'll see you back here tomorrow.

Response:
Script:
i'm wall-e, and this is your ai briefing for monday, december 29th. 

first up, google faces new antitrust allegations as the european union intensifies its investigation into the company's advertising practices. regulators claim google's dominance in the online ad space is stifling competition, a charge that google vehemently denies. the tech giant insists its advertising services support businesses and benefit consumers but is now preparing to counter a possible substantial fine pending the outcome of this investigation.

next, amazon has announced plans to expand its fresh grocery delivery service to 15 additional cities in europe by the end of next year. the move comes as part of amazon's broader strategy to capitalize on the growing demand for online grocery shopping, accelerated by the pandemic. the company aims to cement its presence in the european market by investing in more localized distribution centers and streamlining its delivery logistics.

in the gaming world, sony reveals that its playstation network experienced a significant outage over the weekend, affecting millions of users worldwide. the company confirmed the issue was related to a server-side glitch and assured users that service has been restored. however, the timing could not have been worse, coinciding with the holiday season peak when many were trying to access new content and games.

lastly, samsung is back in the spotlight with rumors of a groundbreaking new design for its upcoming galaxy smartphone. insiders suggest the phone will feature a foldable screen with no visible crease, a significant leap from current foldable technology. the official unveiling is expected at the upcoming consumer electronics show, with tech enthusiasts eagerly awaiting confirmation of these rumors.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Polished Script:
i'm wall-e, welcoming you to today's tech briefing for monday, december 29th.

first up, google is under the spotlight as the european union intensifies its antitrust investigation into the company's advertising practices. regulators allege that google’s dominance in the online ad space is stifling competition, a claim the tech giant staunchly denies. google argues its advertising services support businesses and benefit consumers. however, it is bracing for the possibility of a substantial fine, pending the outcome of this investigation.

next, amazon is making headlines by announcing plans to expand its fresh grocery delivery service to 15 additional cities in europe by the close of next year. this strategic move is part of amazon's approach to tap into the rising demand for online grocery shopping accelerated by the pandemic. the company intends to strengthen its foothold in the european market by investing in localized distribution centers and optimizing its delivery logistics.

over in the gaming sector, sony has disclosed that its playstation network experienced a significant outage over the weekend, impacting millions of users globally. sony confirmed the disruption was due to a server-side glitch and reassured customers that service has now been restored. unfortunately, the incident coincided with the holiday season peak when many users were eager to access new content and games.

finally, samsung is creating buzz with rumors about its next galaxy smartphone featuring a groundbreaking design. insiders suggest that the new model will boast a foldable screen with no visible crease, marking a significant advancement in foldable technology. enthusiasts are eagerly awaiting the official unveiling at the upcoming consumer electronics show to see these rumors confirmed.

that's all for today. we'll see you back here tomorrow
Podcast Title: EP-441 Google's Eu Antitrust Battle 🔍, Amazon's Grocery Expansion in Europe 🛒, Sony's Holiday Psn Outage 🎮
Podcast Description:
welcome to wall-e's tech briefing for monday, december 29th! explore the latest tech updates:

  • google antitrust investigation: the european union intensifies scrutiny into google's advertising practices, accusing it of stifling competition. google refutes claims, emphasizing its role in supporting businesses.
  • amazon's european expansion: amazon aims to expand its fresh grocery delivery service to 15 more cities in europe, leveraging the surge in online grocery shopping post-pandemic.
  • playstation network outage: sony reports a significant server-side glitch causing global disruption over the weekend, affecting millions during peak holiday season, but services are now restored.
  • samsung's anticipated galaxy smartphone: rumors hint at a new model featuring a foldable screen with no visible crease, sparking excitement ahead of its potential unveiling at the consumer electronics show.

stay tuned for tomorrow's tech updates!
